poem:
**Not Going Home**

Neon veins pulse under sodium skies,  
where basslines throb in synchronized ties.  
Eyelids heavy, yet hearts wide awake,  
dawn's embrace a chance they won't take.  
Midnight rebels, in rhythm they roam,  
beyond the clock's chime, they carve their own tome—  
never going home.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "What if you never come down? The 90s clubbers who wouldn’t let the night end – a picture essay It is in the early hours of the morning that one of modern life’s most familiar questions faces you: should we call it a night now, or push on through into the next day? The people in Not Going Home, a new photo book by Mischa Haller, have all taken the second option. Some have gone". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
